capabilities.name: Work Collaboratively
capabilities.description: The role requires forming professional relationships with Traditional Owners, agencies, and stakeholders, indicating a need for effective collaboration.

capabilities.name: Communicate Effectively
capabilities.description: Strong communication skills are essential for liaising with visitors, stakeholders, and managing evolving priorities across various estates.

capabilities.name: Plan and Prioritise
capabilities.description: Managing projects, environmental assessments, and field-based activities requires effective planning and prioritization to handle the role's diversity and flexibility.

capabilities.name: Think and Solve Problems
capabilities.description: The role demands strong decision-making and the ability to think on one's feet, especially in managing natural, historic, and Aboriginal heritage.

capabilities.name: Demonstrate Accountability
capabilities.description: Accountability is crucial for undertaking and supervising projects, ensuring adherence to legislation and policy, especially in environmental and heritage conservation.

capabilities.name: Manage Self
capabilities.description: The role's physical demands and the need for fitness, enthusiasm, and a proactive approach to learning and development highlight the importance of self-management.

capabilities.name: Value Diversity
capabilities.description: Creating a positive, safe, diverse, and inclusive culture is a key part of the role, requiring respect for diverse backgrounds and perspectives.

capabilities.name: Project Management
capabilities.description: Managing capital improvements to infrastructure and bushfire management projects requires effective planning, coordination, and control methods.

capabilities.name: Technology
capabilities.description: Understanding and using available technologies is necessary for maximizing efficiencies in managing over 1,000km of roads and trails and 35 walking tracks.

skills.name: Natural Land Management
skills.description: Applying knowledge of natural land management strategies to conserve flora, fauna, and heritage within national parks.

skills.name: Stakeholder Liaison
skills.description: Engaging with Traditional Owners, agencies, and stakeholders to manage conservation projects and initiatives.

skills.name: Wildfire Management
skills.description: Planning and executing burn planning and wildfire management to protect natural environments.

skills.name: Law Enforcement
skills.description: Enforcing laws and regulations to protect natural, historic, and Aboriginal heritage within national parks.

generalRole.title: Environmental Conservation Officer
generalRole.description: This role involves managing natural, historic, and Aboriginal heritage within national parks, including undertaking and supervising conservation projects, environmental assessments, and field-based activities. It requires a blend of technical knowledge in natural land management, strong communication and collaboration skills, and the ability to plan, prioritize, and solve problems effectively.
